entry.title: hid: Unblock feature reports for mice and keyboards
entry.content:
Update IsAlwaysProtected to consider the type of report (input, output,

or feature) when deciding whether a report should always be blocked on

the basis of device capabilities.



chrome.hid and WebHID block access to mice and keyboards because

access to the input reports from these devices undermines the operating

system's security model by bypassing input focus restrictions.



Previously, feature reports were also blocked out of an abundance of

caution. However, blocking these reports also prevents applications from

accessing vendor-proprietary features that use feature reports.



This CL relaxes the blocking behavior so that feature reports can be

accessed even when the input and output reports are blocked.



Bug: 1432782

entry.title: Clank: Initialize Renderer during Tab Creation
entry.content:
Implement a feature that allows initializing renderers during tab creation to speed up navigation.



As opposed to initializing renderer after navigation start, this

will allow us to optimize and give a head start by having the

renderer ready.

entry.title: Reland "[Read Anything] Test the Read Anything WebUI in a browsertest."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 8f3988a8e799e821754db7ad4fa1d4c6f103ae47



The original change failed in an msan build because of uninitialized

values in the text AXNodes. This reland fixes that by ensuring that

we only set values in AXNodeData if the value was actually passed in

from the js; i.e. if the conversion from v8 is successful. This

modification is done in ReadAnythingAppController.



Original change's description:

> [Read Anything] Test the Read Anything WebUI in a browsertest.

>

> The webui test architecture was not designed to handle untrusted

> tests. This CL replaces the webui test read_anything_app_test.ts with

> a new browsertest, read_anything_app_browsertest.cc. It uses EvalJs

> to inject the scripts written in read_anything_app_test.ts. The

> trade-off is that this wonâ€™t check for untrusted sources being added.

>

> Alternatives explored:

> 1. Migrate test to chrome-untrusted://. This would require upgrading

> the infrastructure which was explored in

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4292217/

> but which would need further design to land.

> 2. Test in chrome:// with iframe of the chrome-untrusted:// UI. This

> requires handling communication across the iframe. Future debugging

> might be tricky.

> 3. Serve webui as trusted just in test build. This means a diverging

> implementation and test.

>

> Bug: 1266555

> Change-Id: Ibe996fd85303310088b1cb52cd939c9c27664528

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4343530

entry.title: Android CCV/CRS: Turn on ChromeRootStoreUsed in fieldtial_testing_config.json
entry.content:
This required modifying tests to ensure that the test root is loaded in X509Utils.java via a ClassHook in ContentJUnit4ClassRunner before the user-added roots are pulled in net/cert/internal/trust_store_android.cc, so that the chrome cert verifier would correctly verify trust for connections to the EmbeddedTestServer. Previous attempts to do this did this at other points in the test loading process, but were unsuccessful for a variety of different reasons, usually in loading the root too late.



We also rely on the fact that the root cert for EmbeddedTestServer is a statically checked in file (at net/data/ssl/certificates/root_ca_cert.pem) as the current solution (starting up the EmbeddedTestServer in a separate APK + calling to get the root cert) requires calling into native code which can't be done easily before the chrome cert verifier loads the user-added roots.



This would be easier if the EmbeddedTestServer was run in process instead of in its own APK; I don't know if it would be feasible or how much work it would be to change this.



Change-Id: Ie035190666dfe32ec7b13d66792ff6cbd7b3c1e7

Cq-Do-Not-Cancel-Tryjobs: true

entry.title: Improve Windows error messages for print spooler running
entry.content:
When the Windows print spooler is not running then it is possible that

getting the default printer can fail but not have a useful error

message. It can instead log an error message of success.



Update this logic in PrintBackendWin to detect when the service is not

running and include this helpful tip in the log.



Also include a similar error message tip in the printing test logic

that determines at runtime if a test should be disabled.

entry.title: Prohibit ownership clashes with ARC bridging
entry.content:
base/mac/bridging.h brings CF/NS casting to ARC with optional

ownership transfer. However, it's possible to pass a ScopedCFTypeRef

to CFToNSOwnershipCast because the ScopedCFTypeRef will implicitly

convert to the underlying CFTypeRef. What then happens is that the

CFToNSOwnershipCast will transfer the ownership to ARC while the

ScopedCFTypeRef thinks it still has ownership. Double release.



This adds a simple overload to CFToNSOwnershipCast to error out in

this case.



One might desire ScopedCFTypeRef to have a member function to release

the owned object as an NS type. The problem is that not every CF type

is bridged, and the overhead of merging the macros that know about

which types are bridged and the template nature of ScopedCFTypeRef is

too much. Best to just remove the footgun for now and add fancy

infrastructure later when it becomes more clear as to what extent it

will be necessary.



Bug: 1280317

Change-Id: I8da7f6ac8bc4b60e4ead2723d2e870cea91df2e4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4493107

Commit-Queue: Avi Drissman

Reviewed-by: Mark Mentovai

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1138708}

entry.title: shortcuts: Use table semantic tags for Shortcuts app
entry.content:
This CL greatly improves the a11y of the app.

Now, each subsection is its own data table, with the title being the

of that table. This alone provides great context and

navigation abilities for screen readers.



You will see quite a few miscellaneous CSS changes -- these are

necessary for the new DOM structure to match the old DOM. Typically,

they remove table defaults (like padding + borders) or correct

issues related to new wrapped elements.



I also removed the aria-label in `input-key` and replaced it with

described-by. This is because aria-labels are typically used for

interactive elements, so using an aria-label here was incorrect.



Incidentally, this CL also fixes a width visual bug (see note in before

screenshot).



I've thoroughly manually tested the a11y of this change using

ChromeVox on my DUT. Everything works as expected, but we'll see

what the a11y team says during their review.



Before:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6GcrcyawzdQZX5n



After:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BKugLhs3zeKwByd



Test: Manual

entry.title: Cleanup shared dictionary code
entry.content:
This CL does small cleanups of the shared dictionary logic to make the

code easier to understand.

- Rename `path_pattern` to `match`, `hashes` to `algorithms`,

`p_value` to `match_value`, `e_value` to `expires_value`, `h_value`

to `algorithms_value`.

- Use base::TimeDelta for `expiration`.

- Use SchemeHostPort for the key of map `dictionary_info_map_` instead

of Origin. This is because we don't use Origin's nonce.

entry.title: Migrate webrtc_test_audio.js to standard getStats().
entry.content:
This test uses the legacy getStats() API which it can't because it is

about to throw an exception due to [1] and the API will be removed in

M117. To keep things simple we use the same setup as the test did prior

to this CL, including using a 0-32768 range for the audio level because

that is what the legacy metric did.



It would be nice to clean this test up and use async/await, but not

this CL...



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4481317



NOTRY=True

connection would then fail to send.

entry.title: Integrate video into existing ambient metrics.
entry.content:
This is the implementation of:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4477584



These record general usage statistics whenever the user selects

one of the screensavers. Video now counts as one of the options

in UMA.



Implementation-wise: This change just boils down to finding every

spot the metrics code was using AmbientTheme and replacing it with

AmbientUiSettings. AmbientUiSettings is the successor to AmbientTheme

that stores which screensaver the user selected. It is backwards

compatible with AmbientTheme; both support conversion to a string

that is the identifier in our metrics. Note some metrics did not

require this replacement and could have used AmbientTheme. They were

switched anyways for consistency purposes throughout the ambient code.

entry.title: HDR/Gainmaps: Use linear interpolation for gainmaps
entry.content:
The gainmap is often 1/4 width and 1/4 height of the base image. Use

linear interpolation in ColorConversionSkFilterCache::ApplyGainmap

(instead of nearest neighbor) to avoid artifacts.



Scale the base and gainmap images independently during decode. In

GpuImageDecodeCache::CreateImageInfoForDrawImage, we were deciding the

mip level for both images based on the AuxImage::kDefault, which

had the effect of applying the same scaling to both image. This is

similar to how, when we do a subsampled decode of YUV images, we

upgrade them to 4:4:4.

entry.title: [omnibox][cr23] Static cache `kChromeRefresh2023Level`.
entry.content:
The param is read 3000 times on startup.

An additional 3000 times per browser window created.

And 200 times per omnibox keystroke.



That's large enough to have measurable omnibox performance movements.

1000 reads / keystroke have had 4-diamond movements in the past. 200

might have smaller than 4-diamond, but still significant, movements.



The read was introduced in crrev.com/c/4382808, which is rolling out

with m114. I'll try to merge this CL into m114. Otherwise, the m114

performance metrics might go off, and we won't know if it's real or just

the param read. m114 dev experiments are already underway, so their perf

metrics might be impacted regardless.

entry.title: Refactor OpenXrInstance management to accommodate Android needs
entry.content:
On Android xrCreateInstance needs to receive the specific Activity

that is creating the instance. Since this could *theoretically* be

different for each different WebContents that attempts to create a

session, we can no longer treat the XrInstance as a singleton. This

thus breaks up the OpenXrStatics class and turns the fact that the

XrInstance is a singleton into something specific to Windows in an

appropriate delegate class. This potentially helps pave the way

towards resolving Issue 1335239.



As a result, this creates an OpenXrPlatformHelper to abstract some

of these differences (both the need from Android to append

additional data when creating a session and some lifetime management

on Windows). It implements a few base methods that were previously

in openxr_util since they now can have a logical home, though some

methods are windows-specific and moved onto that concrete

implementation, so that the XrRuntimeProvider can directly use them.

This further allows us to move a few utility methods, and helps to

consolidate some of the texture initialization that Windows was doing

into a helper to make a more streamlined program.



Both the GraphicsBindings and PlatformHelpers have new static methods

to help expose any extensions that they either need or would want to

be present on the XrInstance. These are implemented as statics to

avoid any awkward usage patterns where we would need to create, e.g.

an incomplete GraphicsBinding for the sole purpose of querying the

extensions that it requires.



Though not consumed yet, also begins to initialize the Android OpenXR

loader as required and to pass the relevant extensions to create an

instance there, since that impacted the shape of and usage patterns of

the PlatformHelper. Actually creating an instance and beginning to hook

OpenXR into the framework will be the next stage of this work.

entry.content:
Fix a crash with Long Screenshot when the image is too

big to preview in the dialog's View.



We used to have a threshold in pixels, now we apply the

100M threshold in bytes by calling the android API

getAllocationByteCount instead.



Also add tests, including a manual test to determine the

scaling threshold in case the limit changes.

calculate the video file size. This reply can be invoked after the

entry.title: [ios] Fix DCHECK crash dismissing Signin and Settings
entry.content:
When the Signin screen is dismissed, and the Settings screen is

dismissed before Signin is completely gone, there is a DCHECK that

fails and a completion block that does not get executed.



It is failing because the enclosing block that would normally run in-line is waiting to run until the Signin screen is dismissed. Then we are trying to dismiss the Settings screen (and run the completion block when the animation is complete), but we can no longer access the presentingViewController because it has already started to dismiss. This change stores a weak reference to the presentingViewController so that we can tell it to dismiss Settings and run the completion block when done.



Fixed: 1441144

entry.title: [iOS] Reland Extract visibility changes from NTP start/stop
entry.content:
Remove NTP visibility changes from the coordinator's start/stop

functions. Starting the NTPCoordinator should not necessarily mean

that the NTP has become visible, ie. when creating an NTP in an

inactive web state. Therefore, these calls should be separate.



This fixes an issue where NTPDidChangeVisibility:YES would be

triggered on an already visible NTP when switching from one NTP

to another.



This is a step in the direction of having more meaningful and

intentional start/stop calls, as it allows the coordinator lifecycle

to be controlled without necessarily updating the NTP visibility.



By separating navigation calls between the NTPTabHelper and the TabEventsMediator, we'll be able to distinguish NTP visibility

changes between web states or within the same web state. This will

be done in a follow-up CL and will help with things like saved scroll

position, as it will be clearer when a user navigated back to an NTP expecting to retain their position.



Small refactoring of NTP visibility function, removing unnecessary properties like `sceneInForeground` and `viewPresented`.



Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4359775

Reviewed-by: Chris Lu

Reviewed-by: Sergio Collazos

Commit-Queue: Adam Arcaro

Cr-Original-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1130015}

entry.title: [Test Automation] Handle Swapping WebContents in WebView
entry.content:
There are a number of secondary WebUI surfaces (e.g. profile picker) that "navigate" by swapping out the WebContents in the WebView rather than navigating the page.



Previously, Kombucha tests would have to manually detect this change

and re-instrument the WebContents. Otherwise, the old instrumented WebContents element would go away, and no new element would be created. This made the tests very challenging to write effectively.



With this CL, swapping a WebContents in a secondary WebUI (i.e. a WebView that is not a tab) is treated by Kombucha as any other navigation - a hide event is sent, and then a shown event is sent when the new WebContents finishes loading. This does mean that the underlying WebContents itself is different, but since we instrument it via the WebView - which does not change - and since the WebContents is basically abstracted away by the framework, there's no reason not to carry the identifier over to the new contents.



No new Kombucha verbs are added. Instead, existing verbs like WaitForWebContentsNavigation() now just work in more situations.



In order to achieve this, the CL switches WebView from using an overridable OnWebContentsAttached() method with a default empty implementation to a listener API. This is used by the test framework and by ExtensionViewViews, which previously overrode the method.



Change-Id: I1ee7d8c1c5b13710f76a159c3741b8eb65a12f06

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4491226

entry.title: Add a counter for ChromeTabbedActivity.on{PreCreate,Resume} between native startup events.
entry.content:
Add a histogram UMA.PreNative.ChromeTabbedActivityCounter. Some notes on the design:

* This histogram is meant to diagnose Clank short sessions.

* In particular, we are investigating issues where Java code starts up, but native C++ code is not reached.

* Normally we would expect the counter to increase from P0R0 to P1R0 when onPreCreate is called, to P1R1 when onResume is called, and then back to P0R0 when native code to track DAU is reached.

* If the native code is not reached, then these counters would be incremented by P1R0 or P1R1 but not reset.

* Hence we are hoping to get some insight into how often these uncaptured short sessions occur, and how far the Java code execution has gone for past occurrences once native code is reached.



R=rkaplow@chromium.org

BUG=1435048



Change-Id: Ic753bfd70841da8c90409884470cb94d4ff97257

entry.title: Add a feature to remove the job memory limit for renderers.
entry.content:
We no longer consider the memory limits to provide a net

security benefit.



See http://shortn/_R7ujz1fB3J (Sorry, internal only) for the

reasoning.



This CL adds a feature to effectively disable the Job memory

limit on Windows, by setting it to 1Tb. A feature is used in order

to measure the increase in memory usage and effect on stability

that might occur as a result of this CL, since some cases that were

previously crashes might now result in more memory consumption.

entry.title: Android: Use prebuilt devil tools for most scripts
entry.content:
It still uses chromium's copies of prebuilts, but no longer defaults

to chromium's copy of tools that need to be built. Namely:

md5sum, forwarder, and dex_commands.jar



The reason for using local copies of these is to be able to test

changes to them. This coverage is maintained by still using them

for non-component builds within gtests & instrumentation tests.



The main motivation for this change is to fix a frequently

occurring error where component builds of the tools do not get

pushed properly to the devices, and then do not work. md5sum also

runs faster when built in release mode, so it doesn't make sense

to use a slow copy of it when building a debug version of chrome.



This is the error output I (and others) see frequently:



W 4.817s TimeoutThread-1-for-Install(FA6AK0304925) Error calculating md5: (device: FA6AK0304925) shell command run via adb failed on the device:

command: a=/data/local/tmp/md5sum/md5sum_bin;! output:

Bug: 1404180

entry.title: Make usagestats behavior backward compatible on Windows.
entry.content:
1. Read of usagestats:

* User install, read from HKCU\[ClientState]\{APPID}\usagestats

* System install, search in the order:

- HKLM\[ClientStateMedium]\{APPID}\usagestats

- HKLM\[ClientState]\{APPID}\usagestats

2. Update of usagestats:

when `usagestats` is present in command line during app install,

updates HKCU|HKLM\[ClientState]\{APPID}\usagestats, and deletes

HKLM\[ClientStateMedium]\{APPID}\usagestats for system install, so

it does not shadow the value in `ClientState`.





Bug: 1439571

entry.title: Fix issue in browser_tests where GetCrashpadDatabasePath could crash.
entry.content:
It was possible for GetCrashpadDatabasePath_ExportThunk or

GetCrashpadDatabasePathImpl to return a nullptr and this could

cause a CHECK in string_piece.h.



In practice, this was only possible when crashpad had not fully

be initialized, which only happens on Windows because chrome_elf

is not used for browser_tests, meaning that the thunk defaulted

to the stub implementation.



However, GetCrashpadDatabasePath was only called for browser_tests

from a small number of places, including from the enterprise

reporting connector for crash reporting, and this was only enabled

if the device was enrolled into CBCM, which none of the bots are.



Therefore, this never hit in automated tests, except on developer

devices that happened to have a CBCM configuration and which

also happened to run browser_tests.



This CL fixes the issue in crashpad to return an absl::optional

for the base::FilePath, which can be verified by the callers.



In order to test this, a new browser_test is added that sets up

a fake CBCM enrollment and calls into the CrashReportingContext

class to trigger the call into crashpad. This would previously

cause a crash on Windows as it does not fully initialize crashpad

in browser_tests - see issue 1427737. On other platforms, this

issue would never have been hit as crashpad gets initialized for

browser_tests.



BUG=1441715



Change-Id: If85a768d94dbee71f9166e76346cbb3fc389ed12

entry.title: [Android][Reauth] Call reauthenticate when clicking on local card
entry.content:
Fifth CL for the Clank settings page implementation: For security, we

will require additional user authentication before showing the local

card edit dialog when mandatory reauth is enabled. Similarly as the

reauth toggle impl, we invoke ReauthenticatorBridge.reauthenticate

to trigger the biometric auth, with useLastValidAuth=false to skip

the grace period. The LocalCardEditor dialog was triggered automatically

by Preference.setFragment. For reauth, we have to manually trigger the

fragment via SettingsLauncher api[1] after user passes the authentication.



Note that: since startFragment will start a new activity, which is hard

to verify local card edit dialog was rendered in tests. Thus we

introduce a new AutofillFragmentObserverForTest to record the rendered

fragment in order to check in test.



Implementation: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cXaJylfd0QEu1j4uK7z796uOZUsHAyEa/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-ITZrUUUdtQuuql-Y0OzwWw



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/browser_ui/settings/android/java/src/org/chromium/components/browser_ui/settings/SettingsLauncher.java;l=84-93;drc=4a9f9fa4829cd4815db19169bccba596a273cdd5

entry.title: Remove background thread machinery in CipherFactory
entry.content:
With ByteArrayGenerator gone, we're no longer running afoul of Android's

strict mode. Android's SecureRandom is nowadays backed by BoringSSL

RAND_bytes which is a function we already call on the UI thread as

base::RandBytes. There is no point in going to a background thread to

generate 32 random bytes.



Bug: 1440828, 1440045, 1150546

entry.title: [omnibox][cr23] Layout.
entry.content:
----- Expanded state -----



tldr: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7MQbh9NkQKUK6SU



Increases left padding of entity, answer, and vector/fav icon left

paddings. Keeps them horizontally centered with each other. Uniform row

height decreases entity image size, so when it's enabled, the entity

padding will decrease.



Also increases the x-position of the suggestion text. Relative to the

popup, the x increases from 53 to 56. The padding between the image and

text depends on the image (e.g. entities are larger, so they have less

padding).



Header row indentation isn't changed, since it's already 16px as

desired.



----- Steady state -----



tldr: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AH79EJg6KzckT9Y



There are a myriad of changes besides the obvious of updating numbers to

match CR23 specs.



- The layout values depend on both the cr23-ss-icons & cr23-layout

features. We plan to experiment with these features independently, so

we need everything to look right when none, either, or both are

enabled. This CL affects both features (as well as the control state).



- Fixes a off-by-1px for the query row icon when the cr23-ss-icons

feature was enabled.

- Fixes a off-by-4px when in keyword mode when the cr23-ss-icons feature

was enabled.



- Query row icons now indent when the popup is opened (similar to query

row text), so that they align with the suggestion icons. Previously,

they stayed in place to align with the SS omnibox icon. This is an

intentional tradeoff. This happens only when the cr23-layout feature

is enabled.

- The keyword separator right padding is decreased from 9px to 8px. This

happens with either the cr23-ss-icons or cr23-layout features are

enabled.

- The padding between the keyword search loop and "Search X" text is

decreased from 21 to 19. This happens only when the cr23-layout

feature is enabled, as it's intent to keep alignment with suggestion

icons & text.

- Location bar left padding decreases from 10px to 4px. This happens

only when the cr23-ss-icons feature is enabled rather than the

cr23-layout feature, because the CR23 icons with 10px look bad, and

the old icons with 4px look bad

(https://screenshot.googleplex.com/oVke7cMVNtAT6GD).

- Sets the right-padding of all LHS icons (webUI, super G, vector icons,

labels, page info, permission chip expanded, & permission chip

collapsed) to 8px when both features are enabled. It's mostly applied

when only the cr23-layout feature is enabled, except for the

permission chip cases, which haven't launched yet, so it didn't seem

worth the effort to pixel-perfecting for this experiment-only state

(i.e. we don't plan to launch cr23-layout without cr23-ss-icons).



- Control behavior, when both features are disabled, should be

unchanged. Except when touch UI is enabled, stuff may shift a few px.

That's fine, we just need to be careful to return to previous behavior

if we decide not to launch cr23-layouts; and we're planning to iron

out touch UI post CR23 launch; and touch UI is already a bit wrong.



- The exact position of stuff depends on the cr23-ss-icons feature, the

cr23-layout feature, whether in keyword mode, whether the location bar

icon is showing a label, whether the popup is open, whether showing a

webUI chip, and the state of the permission chip. This made following

a `x = 2; if (feature_1) x += 4; if (feature_2) x+= 2;` pattern

impossible. Instead, each of the 4 permutation of the 2 features is

handled independently; `if (feature_1 && feature_2) x = 6;`. This also

means we can't use `layout_constants.cc` for the time being. Once we

decide on a permutation to launch, we can move back to

`layout_constants.cc`.



Bug: 1431337

entry.title: Measure idle callback periods by task order not deadline
entry.content:
The existing test code checks whether two tasks ran during the same

idle period by checking the IdleDeadline with which the first task

was invoked and performance.now() when the second task runs. This

causes problems when content_shell is run with

--disable-frame-rate-limit, because it's possible for an idle

period to end early (before its IdleDeadline.timeRemaining()).



This patch switches to using task ordering to verify whether two

idle tasks ran during the same idle period. The test does a rAF

loop, so there should always be a rAF between every two idle

periods.



Bug: chromium:770028

Change-Id: Ib1cc09a788a247b95cdea127896c98e418c11283

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4496548
